sub_title: CEO at ENAULD Health Research and Services / Associate KIT NL
summary:
Ngozi Akwataghibe is a Medical Doctor, Public Health Specialist and a Doctoral Researcher at the VU University Amsterdam. She is also an Associate at Royal Tropical Institute (KIT) in Amsterdam, The Netherlands and a Senior Associate at Oversee Advisory Group. As a public health physician, she has gained expertise in quantitative and qualitative research; evaluations including impact evaluation, project management, capacity building, human resources for health management research, health economics research, health systems strengthening approaches, WASH and health financing. She is especially adept and experienced in designing and using complex and innovative mixed methodologies in research.
She is a mixed method’s expert with extensive experience working with teams in Africa, Asia and Europe. Ngozi has led the development of several innovative proposals that have won contracts from many organizations including the World Bank, UNICEF, Shell, the WHO Alliance for Health Policy and Systems Research, WFP and 3ie 
Currently, she is the Evaluation Team Lead in the  UNICEF WCARO Multi-country Formative Evaluation of the Key Result for Children (KRC) #7 (Birth Registration) for the period 2018-2021 - a nine country project involving Benin, Cameroon Chad, Equatorial Guinea, Guinea, Guinea-Bissau, Ivory Coast, Liberia and Togo. She is also the Evaluation Team Lead for the Evaluation of Cholera Rapid Response Teams in four governorates in Yemen. 
At KIT, she is part of the Health Systems Strengthening (HSS) and a thesis advisor for MPH students. 
Key Skills: 
Designing and implementing complex evaluations
Quantitative and Qualitative research
Capacity building and development
Water, Sanitation and Hygiene 
Health Systems strengthening
Health Economics Research
Project Management
